data.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
Is it not the Lord that teaches understanding and knowledge?
For what matters it to the Lord, if thou wert blameless in thy works?
Wilt thou maintain and plead thine own cause?
Is not thy wickedness abundant,
And thou hast taken security of thy brethren for nothing,
Neither hast thou given water to the thirsty to drink,
And thou hast accepted the persons of some;
But thou hast sent widows away empty,
Therefore snares have compassed thee,
The light has proved darkness to thee,
Does not he that dwells in the high places observe?
And thou hast said, What does the Mighty One know?
A cloud is his hiding place, and he shall not be seen;
Wilt thou not mark the old way,
Who were seized before their time:
Who say, What will the Lord do to us?
Yet he filled their houses with good things:
The righteous have seen it, and laughed,
Verily their substance has been utterly destroyed,
Be firm, I pray thee, if thou canst endure;
And receive a declaration from his mouth,
And if thou shalt turn and humble thyself before the Lord,
Thou shalt lay up for thyself treasure in a heap on the rock;
So the Almighty shall be thy helper from enemies,
Then shalt thou have boldness before the Lord,
And he shall hear thee when thou prayest to him,
And he shall establish to thee again a habitation of righteousness
Because thou hast humbled thyself; and thou shalt say, Man has behaved proudly,
He shall deliver the innocent,
